channel: OLD - Client / Business Development / FAQs asked over emails and during sales
message: IDI QUESTIONS on group debriefs. If the debrief is built into the program, use the course session guidance regarding attendance. If the debrief is sold stand-alone, the ideal group size is 25. In some cases, this can be pushed up to 100 - but this would need to be evaluated on a case-by-case basis.

channel: OLD - Client / Business Development / FAQs asked over emails and during sales
message: I have a couple questions for you regarding LCW’s train-the trainer program. Would Voya need to pay for the site license and the training sessions? Yes, the Train-the-Trainer program consist of two components the site license and the TTT sessions. The site licenses are priced as follows: - Content for 1-2 hr courses ​- $35,000 per course - Content for 3-8 hr courses ​- $60,000 per course Then the cost of the TTT training session is additional. See below for details on 1 vs 2 day TTT training sessions. NOTE - Site licenses are not currently available for some courses including LCW Cultural Immersions and select Cultural Competence Workshops-but if you have great interest in those, we can talk about doing those if the total spend is large enough (i.e. over $1.5m) What is the difference between the one & two day sessions? Would that be a decision we make on which one we go with? Is there a maximum number of trainers we can have trained for the fee? The difference between the one & two day sessions is based on the length of the content. Details and investment amounts: - One Day TTT Program (for 1-2 hr courses) - $20,000 - INCLUDES: Live Course Delivery + Walkthrough of each piece of content + Teachbacks - Two Day TTT Program (for 3-8 hr courses) - $40,000 - INCLUDES: Day 1: Live Course Delivery + Walkthrough of each piece of content​ with Q&A and Day 2 : Teachbacks, practice, and Q&A - LCW can accom m odate up to 10 candidate trainers in each session. Did you provide me with a cost for our Unconscious Bias training (4 hour session)? An off-the-shelf 4-hour session with two facilitators delivering LCW’s UB content is $15,000. Additional Workshop Customizations to adapt content to client’s specific audience (e.g., industry, region, country, or global) or learning objectives are available. When being designed for a firm wide rollout, the typical cost is about $20k for the customization of a ‘global’ version. Additional customizations for specific world regions or parts of the business range are typically starting at $3,000

channel: OLD - Client / Business Development / FAQs asked over emails and during sales
message: Chuck Adams - Clients have asked how do we evaluate our courses, on the weekly training call today (8/30) you talked about level 1 reaction, level 2 reaction for learning, level 3 your behavior changed and is measurable and observable and level 4 results - ROI - impact on the business, the Kirkpatrick's Model. Would love to develop a broad overview LCW slide similar to the Kirkpatrick one so we can provide a snapshot if needed in a deck, i have included some examples of level 1 in some decks, but would love to build out a few predesigned sales slides and have some cheat notes for pricing around the various levels. cc: Melissa Neu , Monica Marcel

channel: OLD - Client / Business Development / FAQs asked over emails and during sales
message: What is your ideal cohort size if delivered virtually vs. in person? LCW Response: Ideal cohort is 25 person, virtually or online.

channel: OLD - Client / Business Development / FAQs asked over emails and during sales
message: Would like more information on ‘boost’ learning or how you support solidification of knowledge into long-term memory through targeted reminders or questions after the learning event. Do you have a support mechanism in place for boost learning? LCW Response: Depending on the budget, content and rollout strategy, we have a host of ‘boost’ learning support ranging from: - pre-scripted “Everyday Inclusion Tips” for leaders to push out via email, to self-discovery - 8 weeks of Behavior Boosts including Reminders and activities to reinforce and practice areas for development identified in previous learning. Received by email, text message, or other client digital channel, for a period of 8 weeks post-course. - Discovery & Practice Guide (for intact teams): Problem-solving and practice tool that will help teams work together to root out unconscious bias and develop concrete conscious inclusion solutions

channel: OLD - Client / Business Development / FAQs asked over emails and during sales
message: Do you have other examples of learner engagement built into the design of the content other than polls and breakouts? Interested to learn more about the design concepts that foster retention in the sessions or see a high level DD to understand the content flow, Learning Objectives and learner motivation/engagement points. LCW Response: In the live facilitated sessions, we also use onscreen animation for example (see below), as well as videos and audio case studies as well as Slido word clouds, and more. Which specific levers we use depend on the course content, objectives, etc.

channel: OLD - Client / Business Development / FAQs asked over emails and during sales
message: Since we’re unsure of what our approach to the workplace will be in 2022, is it possible to provide a hybrid model for this? As in…most cohorts would be virtual (we’d imagine), but there may be a population who have returned to work in some way…is it possible to do a cohort or two in-person or is it just one modality? LCW Response: Yes, this is possible. The pricing will just vary depending on the modality.

channel: OLD - Client / Business Development / FAQs asked over emails and during sales
message: There was mention of breaking down the supporting material by level, one set for individual contributors and one for people leaders. Would the course content be approached that way or just the performance support content? LCW Response: Depending on the roll out strategy, if people leaders are trained separately from individual contributors, facilitated content is best when tailored for the specific level of the participant such as people leaders.

channel: OLD - Client / Business Development / FAQs asked over emails and during sales
message: Can we get a sample IDI report output? I’d be interested to see how in-depth it gets, as well as what is actionable from it. LCW Response - Here are three sample report outputs: 1) Individual Profile Report; 2) Individual’s personal Intercultural Development Plan; 3) Group Profile Report

channel: OLD - Client / Business Development / FAQs asked over emails and during sales
message: Are all of the performance support assets LCW proprietary content, or are these available in a marketplace like LiL? a. If proprietary – would they integrate into our LMS for tracking, or would the learner need to sign in to another external system for access? IF that is the case, need a larger discussion on learner experience and monitoring. LCW Response - Best option: site licenses allow you to host any of our modules on your own LMS

channel: OLD - Client / Business Development / FAQs asked over emails and during sales
message: Will LCW provide updated content to all Enterprise license holders? - We will absolutely provide updates if there is an error in the content. If content is updated for other improvements, sharing this with enterprise license holders will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.

channel: OLD - Client / Business Development / FAQs asked over emails and during sales
message: What are the differences between these courses? - Managing Bias is the Workplace is for Individual Contributors - It assumes in the group that there is a chunk of non-managers. - Individual contributors and non-managers should not be in same succession because this creates a greater awareness of inherent organizational issues with hiring. - Leaders would only go through this program if goal were to have a common conversation – will only address things that everyone can touch. - Does not solve for any leadership issues. - Managing Bias in Talent Management - The general course that illumines bias and all the way that impacts people decisions. - Covers hiring, team meetings, performance reviews. - Managing Bias in Talent Review - Only for leaders doing succession planning and making more strategic hiring decisions. Ideally, put leaders through Managing Bias is the Workplace and Managing Bias in Talent Management . The opportunity for both allows leaders to understand what followers are learning and learn Managing Bias in Talent Management is best approach.
